Comparison with previous debunked image: The expert's verdict mentions that the image in question was previously debunked by Alt News when it was shared as a "tsunami of supporters" in a Modi-Shah rally. This comparison with the previously debunked image helps verify the authenticity of the claim.
Matching attire: The expert's verdict states that the attire worn by BJP president Amit Shah in the image matches with other images of the same event posted by news agency ANI. This aspect of matching attire adds to the verification of the claim.
Source of the image: The expert's verdict mentions that the image can be traced back to December 2017 when PM Modi and Amit Shah were sharing the dais in Shimla for the swearing-in ceremony of Himachal Pradesh CM Jai Ram Thakur. This aspect of tracing the source of the image helps confirm the authenticity of the claim.
Eye: witness accounts: The expert's verdict mentions that several individuals on Facebook and Twitter have claimed that the image represents the recent Modi-Shah rally in Kolkata. While this aspect may not be as strong as the others, it does provide some additional evidence towards verifying the claim.
